The steps to enable compression differ based on the compression type and destinations that you want to use them with:
Using Snappy with the Hadoop FS or HBase destinations You can use Snappy with one version of Hadoop FS or HBase. If you enable Snappy for Hadoop FS and HBase, do not enable it for Cassandra. To enable Snappy for Hadoop FS and HBase, perform the following steps:
Verify the location of the libsnappy.so file.
With the Hadoop installation, the libsnappy.so file is generally installed in the following directory: /usr/lib/hadoop/lib/native/.
If the file is not installed at this location, see the documentation for your Hadoop distribution for the location of the file or instructions on how to install the file. For details, see the documentation for your Hadoop distribution.If you have two versions of Hadoop FS and HBase installed, make sure to locate the file for the version you want to use.
In the environment file, add the libsnappy.so directory to the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable.
For information about configuring the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable, see .
In the Hadoop FS destination, select the Snappy compression codec. In the HBase destination no additional configuration is necessary.
Using LZO with the Hadoop FS or HBase destinations You can use LZO with one version of Hadoop FS or HBase. To enable LZO for Hadoop FS and HBase, perform the following steps:
If necessary, install the Hadoop LZO native library.
If you have two versions of Hadoop FS and HBase installed, make sure you install the version that you want to use. See the documentation for your Hadoop distribution for details.
In the environment file, add the Hadoop LZO directory to the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable.
For information about configuring the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable, see .
In the Hadoop FS destination, select the Other compression codec and enter the full LZO class name. In the HBase destination no additional configuration is necessary.
